Content: The Executive Committee and All Island Working Committee of the SLFP decided today to appoint former presidents and prime ministers for its advisory board. It was decided during the party meeting held under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena at Ape Gama premises. The Executive Committee and All Island Working Committee of the Sri Lanka Freedom Party met this morning under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena. Many Parliamentarians and Senior Members representing the party were present on the occasion. President Maithripala Sirisena was reappointed as the Chairman of the SLFP. Professor Rohana Lakshman Piyadasa was appointed as the General Secretary. Former President Chandrika Bandaranayaka Kumaranatunga, Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa and Former Prime Minister D.M. Jayaratne were appointed to the Party Advisory Board. Former General Secretary Minister Duminda Dissanayake is the new National Organizer. Former Minister S.B. Dissanayake has been named to the post of Treasurer. 11 members have been appointed as the Deputy Chairmen of SLFP. 8 members have been appointed as new Deputy Secretaries. All SLFP Parliamentarians at present, have been appointed to the Central Committee. Apart from this, Chairman of the party would make other appointments to the Central Committee in the future.
